author: individuodigital1
title: Developers Hackaton Stories
description: The Cardano community through his developers is transforming the world and yet the world is still largely unaware. Much of the work we are doing is still unseen outside of the Cardano community.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposers want to do a documentary about the hackathons done in argentina and it's followthrough for developers in the ecosystem. That's an amazing idea and the proposal is up to par as well. Regarding the challenge, I'm not too sure it's in the right category although it does cover some of the challenge settings so I can't be too strict there.
As I see it it could be good marketing that would spread the word about cardano. Charles Hoskinson does say cardano has a problem with getting the message out, so I do believe this is a good idea. Besides that people love documentaries and inspiring real stories so I'm all for this experiment. 
Considering the budget this is a no-brainer for be, because the value to cost ratio is simply too good to ignore. I have a tendancy to trust people more when they are creating content on youtube because you stand there with your name reputation and face infront of the world and that has consequences, so I respect content creators. Especially the ones boostring the cardano name and showing the world what the community has done and what can come from this community effort.
I don't think we need to worry about scaling because documentaries are usually a one of thing, so there's not much need for thought on the scaling front. Overall I like this proposal and the probable impact it's going to have. I also Like how active the spanish speaking part of the community is, because I've already seen quite a few proposals that offer their services in spanish and english. I am sure this is one of the ways to move forward and a documentary does seem like a good idea.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers have provided their credentials and links to verify all the listed skills in the proposal so I managed to verify them without an issue and can say they do have the necessary knowledge to get this done. This is benefitial because it brings the credability of the whole project and any further projects (especially if this one succeeds) up a lot. The authors of the proposal know what they need to do to get the work finished and have planned out a reasonable roadmap with specific milestones and have an hourly breakdown of work, which is proving to be the standard to all proposals because they're easy to compare and check if the hourly rate is within the recommended bounds as this one is. 
This is really helpfull for the assessors like me, because we don't waste time calculating the hourly rate before assessing the budget, so .. thanks for that.
There's good plan for implementation and the timeframe of the whole project seems reasonable to me, but keep in mind I am a developer and I know nothing about these things, just logically it seems like enough time. I like the stages breakdown because it gives me a clear idea of what needs to be done, and gives me knowledge about how are things done when doing a production more or less, so I'll keep that knowledge for the next assessments, so thank you about that as well.
They already have all team members necessary to get things going, which is a big improvement over proposals that need to find the people right after they get the funding, which is way harder.
Overall this seems to me like a feasible proposal and as I already mentioned the value/cost ratio is too good to pass up. Good luck and keep up the great work!
f6_assessments.q2:
I don't know the first thing about measuring the success of a production except for the view count and profits when thinking about movies, but the proposers have listed quite an extensive list of metrics they will follow to gage the adoption and interest so all goot metrics and KPIs wise.
The roadmap with milestones give a good map in the mind of any supporter of the project so they know what to expect and when exactly and thus are enabled to follow along with the project updates and timeline and eventual success.
Proposers have a good problem statement, a simple yet effective solution to build a documentary which is quite nice and the first proposal of this sort I've seen so kudos for that. By the looks of it they do know what they're doing and will involve the local community as they already have done through the hackathons.
Nothing left to do besides stating the obvious - this is an auditable proposal and I recommend voting for it since...for the third time value/cost ratio = amazing!

f6_assessments.q0: The proponent raised the issue of the Cardano Community through the developers, but the world is still largely unknown. Much of the work in progress remains unseen outside of the Cardano community. The proponent set out to solve the problem: produce a TV series and documentary, telling the story of Plutus Hackaton, in Argentina, and its effect on the ecosystem, developers, connecting stories. stories of this community and tell them to the world. The proposed impact on the challenge was posed and described in rich detail. First of all, the author has posed a challenge here. Prove that the author is a competent person, knows what he will do, how to do it, and is on target to execute the project well. There will be 2 products to share Hackaton: Live Streaming and Documentary, bringing it closer to the community, driving more developers to participate in Cardano. However, there is still very little audio-visual material and no Spanish. Besides, the author has mapped the path for 7 specific phases. To create support for hackathon development: will need a document showing that the developer ecosystem in Cardano, telling the story of its network, will address concerns of new developers entering the Ecosystem. The team believes that the best tools to reach out are movies and streaming, and attract new people through video. Proposing specific solution. Besides, the team has recognized the potential risks in the proposal and has many solutions, minimizing the risks when the proposal is implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal outlines a plan for this proposal very clearly and in detail. Milestones are established through 7 stages for each specific activity. The work to be done in the project is analyzed in detail and explained in detail by month and week. We know what work will be done to achieve the ultimate success of the project. Next is the budget. The proposal requires a budget of $5,780. In my opinion, this is quite a small amount of requirements for the project to do. Film production is a complex project that requires a lot of staff, tools, time, etc. A reasonable budget ensures that the work will be carried out smoothly and sustainably. In addition, the team provided a detailed and coherent breakdown of the budget for each job. We know how each budget is allocated. Specifically: the salaries of producers, directors, technicians, locations... are estimated on an hourly rate, throughout the project. Finally, about the core team members. We know the members are all people with the right skills and experience to do the work on the project. At the same time, the author also provides a text presentation about each member, and attaches a link to let us know more about the history and experience of the members that the proposal has presented. In general, the plan of the proposal is very good, the budget is transparent and the members are skilled and experienced, increasing the feasibility of the proposal. Proposal is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The author provides us with many ways to measure project progress. How: Measuring impact in video and streaming (views, comments, and subscriptions) compares metrics each month. Second way: number of people attending hackathons or developer ecosystem. That way, we know what to expect, and at what pace, the benefits are created for the community and the ecosystem. About the end product, that's to be expected, the success of the project, the success of this video: an inspiration for developers new to Cardano. At the same time, the detailed step-by-step roadmap and broken budget make it easy to audit the successful progress of the project. Although it is a completely new proposal, it has shown the experience and expertise of the team, increasing the sustainable strength of the project. Proposal has good auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: In the developer ecosystem, the proposal complies with the challenge's requirements. It is a great idea to document developers' experiences at the Plutus Hackathon in audiovisual form in order to promote adoption geared on inspiring more developers to join Cardano and show how this technological and digital tool may improve people's lives. New cardano and blockchain developers looking for knowledge about the working environment and its constantly developing opportunities can use this livestream and documentary production as a resource. If executed properly, this would unquestionably be a significant revolution for the entire catalyst ecosystem. I do concur, however, that the plan successfully addresses the issue.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal includes a brief introduction to the team members, information about their varied professional backgrounds supplied through their personal LinkedIn profiles, and a published documentary that increases the possibility that the project will be implemented successfully. Additionally, it is clear that the crew is well-versed in the catalyst ecosystem and actively involved in the Cardano community. The plan also outlines a detailed roadmap for the various tasks, objectives, and deadlines it expects outcomes to be attained.
The proposal also highlights that the project is intended for the Cardano community and the wider world, but it omits a reference to the language that will be used in the production. The main justification for this is that majority of the references provides as attachment are in Spanish, when the cardano community and entire catalyst ecosystem is home to a wide range of people from many cultures, nationalities, and languages. Perhaps a linguistic indication and a specified target audience will help documentary and streaming production soar to incredible altitudes.
The proposal's budget breakdown only shows that money will be used primarily to pay crew members' salaries for shooting and transmitting the Plutus Hackathon. When it highlighted that the initiative is aimed towards the developer community, financing for advertisements, promotional materials, and equipment is not cited. However, the total budget requested for this project is extremely reasonable, and with the evidence of published work, I agree that the suggested plan can be effective.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal specifies the growth metrics for the project, which will be assessed by the number of viewers and level of interaction on visual platforms as well as participation in hackathons and ecosystem events. Despite the lack of a monitoring mechanism the community can consult during each milestone, the proposal does mention a potential risk and the how to minimize it. Overall, I concur that the proposal has sufficient information to guarantee the production and streaming of the documentary.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem described in this proposal is closely aligned with the challenge.The team has done a great job by putting the proposal in the right challenge which will provide the materials for developers in the ecosystem that tells the story of its network to address  the interest of new developers to join the ecosystem. The proposal also provides precise solutions to the problem by providing ways to share Cardano developers ecosystem stories in the universal audiovisual language of film and streaming with the mass public and the community, in order to generate adoption focused on motivate for more developers to join to Cardano and demonstrate how this abstract and digital tool can transform lives.
The proposer also captures the key important metrics under the campaign breif by mentioning some of the key values by streaming and a  documentary that tells hackaton stories which will help connect the world of developers. The proposal is also able to scale up to number of developers that will be onboarded onto the Cardano developers ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided relevant links to members of team who will help in the proper execution of the project. The proposer and team from the links provided have the have the required skills and experiences to be able to execute the project if funded and I think is highly commendable. The proposer has also done well by providing a detailed budget which has been broken down into 7 stages showing the details of which each stage will be undertaking to the successful implementation of the project.
The proposer also outlines the milestones by providing the duration with which the project will be funded.
The proposal also considered the main risk associated with the project which include the risk of streaming videos that doesn't have the necessary impact on developers from others ecosystem and not engage new people into Cardano ecosystem . They intend to mitigate this risk tthrough a good network collaborations with the whole Spanish and Latam community to spread the videos in different platforms. They  have already created a big interaction with SPO, YouTube Channels and DAOs that will collaborated with the distribution of this materials to promote the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer and team has clearly outlined on how to measure the progress of the project by the videos platforms views, number of comments, and number of subscribers; and by comparing these metrics each month. Also the proposal will be able to track  the numbers of people attending to the next hackathons or developer ecosystems activities. 
The proposer has provided the key milestones on how success will look like should they be funded by elaborating on the videos about Cardano developers ecosystem that tells the story of its network and how this network is connected with the rest of the nodes in the world through its activities this will help aspire more people into the Cardano developers ecosystem.
This proposal has also indicated how they will be monitored and reported to the Cardano ecosystem this will make the auditability of the proposal easier.

f6_assessments.q0: As we know they are lack of developers in cardano ecosystem, and the present developers who are working are unknown to the world, even if they have produced great works to the project catalyst, Hence the proposer wants to conduct a documentary and share the experience of developers from Argentina where it can inspire other people to join cardano ecosystem and help in building cardano , to make the documentary more successful , the proposer wants set a hackathon so that they can he can get proper visuals for his documentary program , Hence This proposal effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: Conducting documentary on the developer of cardano ecosystem is of moderate work where it doesn't involve any much risk factors, the proposer here wants to achieve the audio recording prior and later conducting documentary shooting while ongoing hackathon which is definitely a great idea, where he wants to live stream the ideas both through such hackathon which is definitely achievable,  However the proposer's team has been producing documentary films of global distribution, and also been producing consistent video content about Cardano though edited videos and streaming content. so conducting a documentary over hackathon for this team is achievable task, Hence with given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit has clear goal to make documentary and bring confidence in new developers towards participation in cardano ecosystem projects, audit has introduced the team members who will be working on the project, to make the project more successful the proposer wants to conduct hackathon so that he can stream the whole Plutus Hackaton and maximum developers of Argentina can participate in it, and conducting interviews while ongoing is a great idea which will be like proven experience to the people, and displaying the results i.e the ideas born through hackathon is also great boost to the project.
Audit contains detailed budget breaking idea to complete the project, it even contains well structured to roadmap to make the project more efficient, Hence The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal directly answers the challenge requirements in the developer ecosystem. The idea to create audiovisual experiences of developers and their journeys in the Plutus Hackathon, Argentina, invites a new perspective into the life of active cardano developers. This streaming and documentary production can serve as a point of reference for new cardano developers and blockchain tech newbies, looking for information on the work environment of cardano and its ever expanding opportunities. This would definitely be a lead conversion system for the cardano ecosystem should it be strategically implemented and successful. However, in my opinion, the author could have shed more light on the specific strategies in place to promote the film/documentary and the assigned budget. Nonetheless, I do agree that the proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The author provides a brief background of the team involved with the project, their diverse work experiences shared through LinkedIn links and a published documentary that shows proof of work and strengthens the likelihood of a successful project implementation. It is also evident that the team members are cardano community members, and are familiar with the ecosystem and what drives it. The proposal also details a clear roadmap for the various activities and milestones, and the timeframes it predicts for results will be achieved. The author further emphasizes that the project is directed towards the cardano community and the world, however, the proposal fails to mention the language the production is set to use. Reason being that most of the audiovisual references included as attachment are in Spanish yet the cardano ecosystem houses a variety of people with diverse cultures, ethnicities and languages.  Perhaps a language indication and a specific target audience can produce astronomical heights for the streaming and documentary production. Looking at the budget breakdown, the proposal only indicates that funding will mostly be spent on crew members salaries and on tickets and accommodation for the Plutus Hackathon. There is no mention of funding for promotional materials and equipment. However, the amount ask, is very budget friendly and with the proof of published work, I agree that the proposed plan can be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: Growth indicators for the project are stated in the proposal, and are to be measured by the viewer count and interaction level on visual platforms as well as attendance rate at hackathons and ecosystem activities. Unlike the platforms that provide inbuilt analytics for creators, the proposal makes no mention of how to keep a registry of attendance and measure its improvements or decline. The proposal shows no tracking system the community can reference during each milestone, but it does include an identified risk and the measures in place to mitigate it. All in all, I agree that the proposal contains more than enough to ensure the success of the documentary production and streaming.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating a Cardano storyline, a well built narrated timeline that catches the spectator is an effective way of expanding Cardano’s community and drawing in new high-calibre developers into the Ecosystem. Telling the story of Cardano through a cinematographic language may be the missing element of the equation. If we want to grow as a Community we need to have our own story, our own experience and our own way of telling it. Addressing this narrative issue can be really effective in drawing in new opportunities and will launch us into the international language of audiovisual content which is today so fundamental specially in social media. Cardano Community is really making history but the world may not be finding it out. It is also important to highlight that the narrative may be reachable to everybody and not only experts as there is a great deal of interest in the wide audience in this type of projects and it is certainly not yet addressed.
f6_assessments.q1: Although this would be a first experience project in regards to Catalyst funding, the team experience seems enough to deserve this and further funding in their proposals as their plan is excellently built and certainly enhances confidence. It is one of Cardano’s principles and goals expanding their horizons and always open to giving new opportunities. The Audiovisual Team, Project Director, Executive Producer and Streaming Director have demonstrable experience in their fields. The fact that this proposal has not been funded in the previous fund and yet survived is also a guarantee of persistence and their will as a team of accomplishing their goals.
f6_assessments.q2: The impact measurement of the audiovisual content is efficient and yet not sufficient. Another type of measurement might be needed in order to effectively audit the production process. An interesting way of addressing this issue might be asking the team to share within Cardano Community and a variety of different social media the audiovisual process of producing and actual filming. It might be interesting for the wide audience to get to know the backstage and behind the scene content also.

solution: A streaming and a documentary that tells the story of Plutus Hackaton in Argentina and its outcomes for the developers ecosystem, connecting the stories of this community and tell them to the world.
experience: Our team has experience producing documentary films of global distribution, in addition to producing consistent video content about Cardano though edited videos and streaming content.
